summary: This is an email chain from August 10-11, 2019, discussing coordination between law enforcement and legal representatives regarding Jeffrey Epstein. It involves the FBI/NYPD Violent Crimes Task Force, the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY), and an attorney representing a 'possible girlfriend' of Epstein.

persons.name: Maurice Secarz
persons.context: Identified as the attorney for a 'possible girlfriend' of Jeffrey Epstein. He is the point of contact for legal representation in this matter.

connections.description: Maurice Secarz is identified as the attorney representing a 'possible girlfriend' of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Coordination on Epstein Case
events.description: Law enforcement and prosecutors coordinate via email regarding the Epstein case, specifically mentioning contact with an attorney for a 'possible girlfriend'.

keyFacts: The email chain is dated August 10-11, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.
An attorney named Maurice Secarz is identified as representing a 'possible girlfriend' of Jeffrey Epstein.
Coordination is occurring between the FBI/NYPD Violent Crimes Task Force and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY).
The communication shows law enforcement and prosecutors working on a Saturday, indicating the high-priority nature of the Epstein investigation post-death.
The primary purpose is to establish points of contact for legal and investigative assistance related to the Epstein case.
